params.batch: Invocation[] - The batch of invocations to process.

returns._0: success bool - Whether the batch of invocations was successfully processed.

params.delegation: Delegation - The delegation to get the type of

returns._0: bytes32 - The type of the delegation
bytes32 - The domain hash of the calling contract.
bytes32 - The type of the Invocations

params.signedInvocations: SignedInvocation[] - The batch of signed invocations to process.

returns.success: bool - Whether the batch of invocations was successfully processed.

returns._0: address - The address of the account authorizing this invocation to act on its behalf.

contractInvoke(((address,uint256,bytes),.notice: Allows a smart contract to submit a batch of invocations for processing, allowing itself to be the delegate.

getDelegationTypedDataHash((address,byte.notice: Returns the typehash for this contract's delegation signatures.

getInvocationsTypedDataHash((((address,u.notice: Returns the typehash for this contract's invocation signatures.

invoke(((((address,uint256,bytes),((addr.notice: Allows anyone to submit a batch of signed invocations for processing.

setDomainHash(string).notice: Typehash Initializer - To be called by a diamond after facet assignment. Yes, anyone can assign the facet's own name, but it doesn't do anything, so it's fine.

verifyInvocationSignature(((((address,ui.notice: Verifies that the given invocation is valid.
